channel.title: Comments on: Monday Go Meditation: Game 21

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: The reading was immaculate. After all, it was your double hane that caused me to just stare at the board and resign. =P I can only imagine what's in store for our game tonight!
item.content:encoded: The reading was immaculate. After all, it was your double hane that caused me to just stare at the board and resign. =P I can only imagine what’s in store for our game tonight!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: While you may say it's "humiliating," I must say that this sort of all or nothing battle certainly gets the heart racing. The slightest misstep even by the attacker can result in all impending doom (as witnessed in this game). Not to mention I thought you handled yourself very well. =D
item.content:encoded: While you may say it’s “humiliating,” I must say that this sort of all or nothing battle certainly gets the heart racing. The slightest misstep even by the attacker can result in all impending doom (as witnessed in this game). Not to mention I thought you handled yourself very well. =D

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: The only thing I should admit is that it WAS nice to win a game by correctly reading a double hane on the side, considering my misread of the same phenomenon caught me in my workshop game against Nathan. (http://nateeagle.com/2013/06/10/workshop-game-against-a-new-little-brother/, move 47.)
item.content:encoded: The only thing I should admit is that it WAS nice to win a game by correctly reading a double hane on the side, considering my misread of the same phenomenon caught me in my workshop game against Nathan. (http://nateeagle.com/2013/06/10/workshop-game-against-a-new-little-brother/, move 47.)

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: This was a rough game. There's something so humiliating about being caught in a situation where you have to struggle to find some desperate chance to save a cut-off group. I don't enjoy it, even when I manage to save my skin. (Though, to be clear, it's a lot easier than when I DON'T manage to save my skin.) I want to always have a plan. So, to me, white comes off better in this game - your whole-board plan for building potential on the top was great, and still looks great despite the end of the game.
item.content:encoded:
This was a rough game. There’s something so humiliating about being caught in a situation where you have to struggle to find some desperate chance to save a cut-off group. I don’t enjoy it, even when I manage to save my skin. (Though, to be clear, it’s a lot easier than when I DON’T manage to save my skin.) I want to always have a plan.
So, to me, white comes off better in this game – your whole-board plan for building potential on the top was great, and still looks great despite the end of the game.
